Name: Daniele Jesus Lafon
Description:
Daniele was stabbed with a pair of scissors. According to the neighbours arguments were heard at Daniele’s house on several occasions, and her family suspects that the crime may have been committed by a former partner.

> Police were called by neighbors of the victim on Sierra Leone Street in the Parque das Nações neighborhood. They were suspicious because the dogs were barking a lot and decided to go to the woman's house. When they broke through the door and entered the building, they noticed the stench and found Danielle Jesus Lafon dead. 
> 
> A pair of scissors that might have been used in the crime was collected by the Civil Police for forensic tests. Witnesses told the Military Police that the [trans woman] was visited between the last Thursday (31) and Saturday (2), during which time the crime may have occurred. Witnesses said one of the visits was by a motorcyclist who was attending the woman's house. There is a suspicion that they have a relationship.

TvT partner organisation Rede Trans Brasil & G1 Sul de Minas 02/09/2017

https://homofobiamata.wordpress.com/2017/09/02/daniele-jesus-lafon-47-anos-tesouradas-mg-pocos-de-caldas/

https://g1.globo.com/mg/sul-de-minas/noticia/corpo-de-transexual-e-encontrado-com-perfuracoes-no-pescoco-em-pocos-de-caldas-mg.ghtml

Name: Ally Steinfeld
Description:
Ally was tortured and repeatedly stabbed in a friend’s living room. Her eyes were then gouged out and her body burned by the same “friends” in an attempt to conceal evidence of the crime. One of the “friends” involved was an 18 year old she had been dating for a week.

In December 2017 Isis Schauer, 18, pleaded guilty to second-degree murder and was sentenced to 20 years in prison. In July 2018 James Thomas Grigsby, 25, pleaded guilty to the abandonment of a corpse. He was sentenced to four years in prison.

Andrew Vrba, 18, and Briana Calderas, 24, await trial on first-degree murder charges. Evidence shows that the murder was planned by Vrba.

Ally's Instagram profile is https://www.instagram.com/allyleesteinfeld/.

"Ally Lee Steinfeld Is The 21st Transgender Person Allegedly Murdered In 2017 So Far"

TvT project: The Advocate & The Washington Post, 22.09.2017

https://www.bustle.com/p/who-was-ally-lee-steinfeld-the-transgender-teen-was-allegedly-brutally-murdered-2455708

Name: Flávia Furtado
Description:
Flávia was sitting with a group at a bar table on the sidewalk when she was shot twice in the chest by an armed man. She died in hospital soon after entering the emergency room.

Her killer fled, but the registration of the car he drove was reported by witnesses and her murder was recorded by CCTV.

> In social networks, relatives and friends lament what happened. “Another injustice with a wonderful human being who will miss her simplicity and humility, walk in peace,” a friend said.

Name: Brandy Bardales Sangama
Description:
Brandy died in San Martin de la Plata hospital after 22 days of agony. She was the third of four trans women to die in La Plata as a result of criminalisation and humiliating police procedures — the others being Pamela Macedo Panduro, Angie Velásquez Ramírez and Damaris Becerra Jurado.

> Brandy was originally from Iquitos, Peru, and resided in La Plata for 4 months.
> 
> It all started with a police raid in search of drugs at a house where Brandy rented a room. The Otrans organisation reported that the police entered the house without a court order, and forced the residents to the floor before confiscating their cell phones and money.
> 
> During this ordeal Brandy began to vomit blood. The police did not help her or call an ambulance, but just took pictures. When the raid was over, they took her to the hospital, where the doctors reported that she had suffered a cardiac arrest before arriving. Brandy was admitted to intensive care, but died 22 days later.

Brandy's death was not recorded on the official TDoR 2017 memorial list.

https://primerapagina.info/2017/08/26/denuncian-nueva-persecucion-y-mal-trato-a-mujeres-trans-en-la-plata/

https://www.pagina12.com.ar/63056-urgente

https://www.pagina12.com.ar/80840-transfobia-de-estado

Name: Brenda Murillo Alba
Description:
Brenda was stabbed with a knife. She was taken to hospital but died a month later.

> After fighting for her life for a month, a [trans woman] died at the General Hospital Tuesday morning as a result of gunshot injuries.
>
> On August 11, a [woman] identified as [deadname], who called herself "Brenda", 20, was on public roads, in the North Zone, when she was attacked by a subject with a knife.
>
> The victim was seriously injured in the neck and was transferred critically to the General Hospital.
>
> The medical report explained that the injury affected her spine and, as a result, she could not speak.
>
> After being treated for a little over a month, "Brenda" was declared dead on Tuesday at 9:10 a.m.

https://web.archive.org/web/20180902103048/http://www.frontera.info/EdicionEnLinea/Notas/Noticias/13092017/1255735-Fallece-Brenda-luego-de-un-mes-en-el-hospital.html

And we are going to overthrow the house of vagabondage, because here in Bahia has command, has action. There are more unidentified bodies in IML / BH and no one will pay for it, because it got used to being that way. But do not mess with us because we do not just go anywhere in the world. “

Name: Lu Brasil
Description:
Lu was strangled. Her body was found at home with cut marks to her mouth, her feet tied and a net entwined around her neck. The bathroom had a broken mirror and there was a bloodstains next to the bed.

She was a TV presenter, and after her death tributes were received from thousands of fans, lamenting the violent death, describing the episode as "cowardice" and "cruelty" and demanding "justice."

The Association of Press Professionals of Altamira, Transamazon and Xingu (ASPIATX) also spoke out, expressing solidarity with the families and receiving justice.

> "The presenter was a relaxed and charismatic communicator. Communication professionals hope that the authorities will be able to elucidate the case as soon as possible, a barbarism against a media professional and a crime that once again shakes the population of this city, " the statement said.

TvT partner organisation Rede Trans Brasil & Giro Portal.com 26/09/2017

Name: Bianca
Description:
Bianca was a sex worker, and had rented a house in Arnhem to work from. On her first day there she was stabbed over twenty times by her first customer (and potentially one or more accomplices). The house was reported to be full of bloodstains, and police have apprehended one suspect.

> I do not know whether to vomit, scream or cry. For the murder, with all the gruesome details of blood traces on walls and paving stones, to the tone and word choice of this article that this woman is deprived of every dignity, respect, humanity and identity.
> 
> Bianca, dear editorial of the Gelderlander, was a woman who had probably been victim of her entire life for people who did not take it as full?—?not as a woman and not as a person. Bianca was not a man who looked utterly like a woman, she was a woman, perhaps more aware of her femininity than most women ever will be, and paid the highest possible price with her death. What she has between her legs does not appeal to a reader. This makes the editors guilty of sexual objectification.
> 
> The reason why so many female trans persons work in prostitution is equally painful: they are not accepted for any other profession. Not even in the Netherlands. Transgender people do not have the greatest arrears and the weakest financial position of all groups in our society for good reason. Imaging is thereby all-determining. And let the media now constantly miss the shelf.
